description: Chinese are a versatile civilization with a focus on strong economy and powerful archers.
dark_age: Start with 6 villagers and a scout.
Build 2 houses, a lumber camp near forests, and a dock near fish.
Train additional villagers from the town center.
Train 3 militia or archers from the archery range or barracks.
Use the scout to explore the map and find resources.
Advance to Feudal Age at around 20-22 minutes with 500 food and 200 gold.
Assign 4-5 villagers to food, 2-3 to wood, and 1-2 to gold.
feudal_age: Build additional archery ranges and continue producing archers.
Build a blacksmith to upgrade archers and a market to sell excess resources for gold.
Build a second lumber camp or mining camp as needed.
Advance to Castle Age at around 27-29 minutes with 800 food and 200 gold.
Assign 8-10 villagers to food, 5-6 to wood, 3-4 to gold, and 2-3 to stone.
castle_age: Build additional archery ranges or stables and continue producing units.
Research the unique technology, Great Wall, for improved walls and towers.
Build a second town center and start training villagers.
Advance to Imperial Age at around 34-36 minutes with 1000 food and 800 gold.
Assign 20-25 villagers to food, 10-12 to wood, 8-10 to gold, and 4-5 to stone.
imperial_age: Train powerful chu ko nu archers and research the unique technology, Rocketry, for improved archer performance.
Build trebuchets and siege units to destroy buildings.
Use monks to convert enemy units or heal friendly units.
Assign additional villagers to gold and stone as needed.
Build multiple castles to produce unique unit, the Chu Ko Nu.
Have a strong economy with plenty of resources to support army production and research.
Assign villagers as needed to maintain resource balance and continue army production.
